Abstract: This autobiographical study explores the persistence of individuals living with neuropsychiatric systemic lupus erythematosus (NPSLE), focusing on their interactions with colleagues and the pursuit of enjoyment amidst challenges. Through personal narrative, it highlights the resilience and adaptive strategies employed to navigate the complexities of NPSLE, offering insights into the lived experience of chronic illness and the importance of social support and personal fulfillment in sustaining quality of life.
